snippet: Teams of Hasidic Jews and black immigrants from the Caribbean came together to play soccer in the Crown Heights Cup, in a section of Brooklyn with a history of tension.
abstract: Soccer teams of Hasidic Jews, give or take a ringer or two, have been facing off at least once a year in Brooklyn's Crown Heights Cup against teams made up largely of black immigrants from the Caribbean; annual rivalry in area once torn by race riots had its start in program known as Seeds in the Middle, part of effort by black and Jewish leaders to bring their communities together.
lead_paragraph: Teams of Hasidic Jews and black immigrants from the Caribbean came together to play soccer in the Crown Heights Cup, in a section of Brooklyn with a history of tension.

headline.main: In Crown Heights, Once Torn by Race Riots, a Friendly Game of Soccer
headline.print_headline: In Crown Heights, Once Torn by Race Riots, a Friendly Game of Soccer
